TopicTitle: Constructing a SpaceCrane, help is required!

Articles.Content:

So, can someone give me a smallish compact and part efficient gimbaling system that lets me swing left and right to move a decent sized object of about 4.5 to 5 tons on and off the craft while in orbit?

It is purely for the rule of cool, I can do without, but I wanted to try first and ask you, the community, on how to solve this dilemma.

Yeah... but this is for a centrifuge, right? To use in space? And you decouple the rotor. Well, the very first time you hit timewarp, say goodbye to your rotor assembly, because it will float free ghosting through the rest of the ship. Ditto for when you leav it on rails, each independant ship will follow a slightly different trajectory and they won't constrain each other with physics unloaded. One of the stock limitations that made me ditch the concept long ago.

Rune. Get IR and save yourself the trouble, if you want to really use it in game.

Yeah it's time they put bearings in stock game.

Anyway, the problem is not your construction, the problem sits in the configuration files of the new MK3 parts. Breakingforce and Breakingtorque are set ridiculously low. Since the shape is a direct copy of B9's work, compare his values with the ones Squad has chosen.

Well, maybe I can have a jr docking port it can spin on? All I want is something that can rotate 90 degrees to move something from the center of the ship to outside of it. :/

Thanks for the heads up about the timewarp. Forgot about dannys video where he phases through stuff.
